alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 3:41PM EDT until May 18 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produced the heavy rainfall has ended over the area, but there is another area of thunderstorms to the west will slowly move east into the advisory area. These new thunderstorms will be capable of producing another 1 to 2 inches of rainfall on top of the already 1 to 3 inches that has fallen earlier this afternoon. Therefore, the flood advisory will remain in effect until 5 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, West Perrine, Zoo Miami, Richmond Heights, Goulds, Richmond West, Cutler Bay, Palmetto Bay, Country Walk, Princeton, The Crossings, West Kendall, The Hammocks, Naranja, Sunset, Kendale Lakes and Homestead Base. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
